content: Game fine until near the end. Im stuck. I cant leave the board im on. It shows the exit icons but i cant use them. I cant finish your bugged down game that i paid for.
Immersive and lots of playing time. It doesn't eat a lot of battery and will keep you engaged for hours. It ties in the story between BG1 and BG2.
The combat is passable. However the story is complete and utter garbage. It does not tie into the other two games well, and the railroading is atrocious.
It was a bit of a struggle to get used to the UI but it buffs out. My only complaint is you can't import a multi-player game from BG1.

This game sucks compared to Balder's gate. You hardly get any magic items and you cannot go anywhere but where the game tells you to go. The battles are way to hard for the magic items available. Poor game play also in multi player it freezes and kicks you out all the time.

I don't care what anyone says about this game I never played the BG games back when they came out. I recently finished BG1 and then played this. I loved it. You do get railroaded a bit but that's not a bad thing. After BG1 almost having too much freedom. Great story some wicked big battles. If you are on the fence. Just give it a try. You won't be disappointed. Onto BG2 now can't wait.
followup to baldurs gate 2. awesome game. best played on a tablet. highly recommended
A fine continuation to the BG storyline, and it ties together the first and second games well.
Best RPGs ever. Played bd1 and almost done with bd2. Has minor bugs, like when you tap on an item in your inventory, you can put it anywhere on the screen! That's all really.

content: I understand that a lot of people aren't too happy with SoD because of some progressive elements and "railroading." Railroading happens often in the BG Saga, so this shouldn't an issue at all, I actually like how it nicely sets up the transition to BG2, rather than the normally abrupt BG1>2. I don't have enough space to cover exactly how the progressive stuff is really done well and inobtrusive if you want it to be. Gameplay-wise, lots of tough, fun battles, cool items, and some neat quests.

content: Baldur's Gate - SoD delivers. A classic AD&D setting in-between the part one (Candlekeep) and the sequel BG 2. The gameplay, characters, and adaptation to Android (chromebook in my case) are all pretty good, some glitches in graphics, some freezes in cutscene (doppelganger), but mostly it is good quality, decent music, and the group-NPC we can recruit (varying by our protagonists choice of class, attributes, and alignment) help to enjoy this (Goblin shaman granny is cool). The story is military flavored, and even story-mode may mean a non-combat character gets killed. Further the battle options, exp, and loot grow due higher difficulty, which some players prefer. The AI scripts are improved, and while some known issues remain (stop running against the wall, how about healing before I die?) it grants more decision making to the player. In example my ranger-stalker uses stealth frequently, while my rogue-swashbuckler focuses only detecting traps. The usage of items & healing potions was improved, but supply can run low. Many mini-quests have different themes & moods, and each NPC we can recruit has a romance, a backstory, and one quest he or she MAY ask us to help along with. The best 2,4 Gigabyte I downloaded since purchasing a chromebook contract. I did not yet test Multiplayer though.
replyContent: Nice, thanks for sharing!

content:
Haven't played, installing full saga. When I do play this I will update 
rating. However, BG:EE, BG2:EE, IWD:EE, and Planescape: Torment are all 
awesome games so I don't expect this game to be any different! Love you 
guys, Beamdog!!

I wish I read other reviews before buying this game. The reviews on Play 
are skewed. Is this a dentist game? Is this game cute? Is that the only way 
to get a positive review? Seems to be. I do not know anyone that plays D&D 
to relive the horrid behaviour of the real world. From the beginning you 
will be inundated with the refugee crisis. The crisis (which unless you 
have been in a cave with your head up your arse for a decade) has caused 
such an uproar in the world. So, every now and again I chose escape the 
garbage of both the left and right. Escape the hyperbolic nonsense. My 
neighbour is a refugee and we enjoy tea and I help build their home etc. I 
have been going to pride with my friends (no, I will not label them.) for 
30 years. I do not feel this games writer has either of those experiences. 
From the get go the game is difficult/annoying to move through. My guess is 
this is supposed to show the player how horrible the world is and the 
refugee crisis has affected all, even the BG universe. Effectively the game 
becomes unwieldy and I long to return it and get my money back. This will 
not happen sadly. I was so excited. BG is a grand universe. This is a 
disturbingly poor representation. I do hope that the developers learn 
nuance for their future endeavours.
Great Game. Wonderful port.

Tryed playing it but it lags so much character movement is so slow and 
buggy makes it almost unplayable and I have more than enough ram and space 
to run the game. I'd really like to play this without the issues please fix
replyContent:
Hello!
To mitigate lags, can you try:
- playing zoomed in,
- turning off quickloot
- minimizing portraits?

Also, any report on support.baldursgate.com with information about your device&OS and times/places/conditions when it's especially laggy for you, will be much appreciated.

screen. It is playable but not an optimal experience. Text scales but UI 
does not and so it is difficult to manage inventory, impossible to see hit 
points and disease status on character portraits, or identify individual 
character names in a croweded room. I think this would be an excellent game 
on a recommended device so go against beamdog's recommendation at your own 
peril.

Fantastic! The game is a worthy addition to the BG trilogy and full of rich 
side quest dungeons and surprises. For example, animals and monsters now 
fight each other rather than just waiting around to attack bands of 
adventurers. This adds so much depth and realism to the world. The side 
quests are deep-not just fetch quests. Also, you need to search the entire 
area to find them. That adds a sense of real discovery and adventure in the 
way the best DMs run their campaigns. The only thing missing is the need to 
carry dice, large sodas and snacks to the session.
replyContent: Nice! Thanks for your review!

content: I didnt know what to think when i went to play this game. I heard a lot of people complaining about things but either it was patched or didnt matter to me. Now am playing these games in order so i still have bg2 to play its my first  time going through this trilogy. I was about to stop playing after the frist bgee because i found it boring so many fetch quest. To me the story line wasnt   that interesting but i am so glad i decided  to buy this game. The quest are interesting, the maps are done a lot better instead of walking around in a empty map they made them smaller which was one of the best things they could have done. The side quest come in chapters so you can do them while your out traveling most can be done and a few can be done later. The main story line was a lot  longer. The way it weaves in and out while doing other quest was excellent. I would recommend  this game to anyone  who enjoys rpgs. I hope beamdog makes more rpgs even if there not related to bg. You got yourself a die hard fan. Thanks for all the fun the passion  you put in this game really shows.  Negative  Am on note 8- When trying to look at map it seems to freeze Some side quest glitch Some voices dont play in particular Jaharia.
replyContent:
Hello! Thanks for your review.
Can you please report the part about freeze/glitch on support.baldursgate.com - our bug tracker.

content: Absolutely amazing. So glad to play on mobile.  As I am sure you know, there are many issues with the smoothness of this game. I look forward to it being fixed.  Here are times when the game lags:  - when in a party of six - the beginning of the game during battle - when many spells are being cast at the same time - during battle intensive moments - upon selecting dialogue options - upon selecting an item in your inventory - when in large areas - upon entering the map in large areas  Other glitches:  - game crashes when selecting Area Map Background in large areas and will not load the map if selected in settings - the important quests section in journal constantly says it's completed when it's not  Suggestions for the (far) future:  - add Caelar as a DLC companion for Throne of Bhaal, where she can be pulled from Hell? - add M'Khiin into Shadows of Amn as a DLC companion, maybe found in Umar Hills or Trademeet, or maybe even being tormented in the city of Amn! - add Schael Corwin as a DLC companion for Shadows of Amn, maybe tracking the main character down after hearing of some of their escapades in Amn? She was my favourite character from Siege of Dragonspear and would love to see more of the romance with her.  I don't expect it to happen but I would love to see Glint in BG2, as well as Voghiln, maybe he could be recruitable when he shows up in Neera's Throne of Bhaal quest?  Overall, fantastic experience. Thank you for creating such a great game, Beamdog.
replyContent:
Thanks for your reviews!
Can you please file those issues on support.baldursgate.com - our bug tracker?

content: Amazingly well done port of SoD. The Infinity Engine translates extremely well to touch screen. The game it's self was really well done. My Party from Baldurs Gate imported without a hitch. I love how they got the original voice cast back for this as well. I'm really enjoying the tweaks to the IE. Like they way the scripts are listed and spell names next to the symbols.  I really hope we see more original IE content from Beamdog. Especially on Android because my favorite way to play IE games is on the touchscreen.
